required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pars Plana Vitrectomy Alone in the Treatment of Macular Schisis in High Myopic Eyes
clinical_study.official_title: Application of Pars Plana Vitrectomy in the Treatment of Macular Schisis in High Myopic Eyes

lead_sponsor.agency: Aier School of Ophthalmology, Central South University

clinical_study.source: Aier School of Ophthalmology, Central South University

brief_summary.textblock: High myopic schisis (HMF) has the clinical feature of separation between retinal layers. It is sometimes accompanied with foveal retinal detachment, macular lamellar hole, epiretinal membrane and vitreous retraction. HMF may develop to macular hole, macular detachment and will damage the visual function. Pars plana vitrectomy (PPV) is a commonly used surgery in the treatment of HMF. PPV together with internal limiting membrane (ILM) peeling and long-term gas tamponade was reported to be safe and effective. But nowadays there was no available long-term gas in our country. Also, whether ILM peeling is necessary remains controversial, Indole cyanine green (ICG)was proved to have potential toxicity to the retina and the ILM peeling has the risk of causing secondary macular hole. We propose to make a prospective nonrandomized controlled study to evaluate the safety and efficiency of using PPV alone in the treatment of HMF.

primary_outcome.measure: The morphologic change of macular area
primary_outcome.time_frame: OCT will be done one day before surgery and one week, one month, three months and six months after surgery
primary_outcome.description: The thickness of the macular fovea in optical coherence tomography (OCT)

secondary_outcome.measure: The best corrected visual acuity (BCVA) change
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One day before surgery and one week, one month, three months and six months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The BCVA of all involved patients

secondary_outcome.measure: The best corrected near visual acuity (BCNVA) change
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One day before surgery and one week, one month, three months and six months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The BCNVA of all involved patients

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One day before surgery and one week, one month, three months and six months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The contrast sensitivity of all involved patients

arm_group.description: Patients who are diagnosed as high myopic macular schisis and agree to receive pars plana vitrectomy as the treatment are planned to allocated in this group

intervention.description: pars plana vitrectomy without ICG staining and ILM peeling

study_pop.textblock: Study population will be selected from the in-patients in Shanghai Aier Eye Hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients diagnosed as high myopic macular retinoschisis, with axial length more than 26.5mm.
2. Morphologic manifestation in OCT shows split between retinal layers in macular area.
3. Patients without severe systemic disease and can tolerate surgery.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients also have other ocular disease, including glaucoma, keratitis,uveitis, retinal detachment,etc.
2. Patients with nystagmus or have difficult to open the eye.
3. Patients with severe systemic disease and cannot tolerate surgery.

reference.citation: Chang JS, Flynn HW Jr, Engelbert M, Shane AR, Smiddy WE, Chang S. Pars plana vitrectomy in patients with myopic macular retinoschisis. Br J Ophthalmol. 2014 Apr;98(4):534-7. doi: 10.1136/bjophthalmol-2013-304578. Epub 2014 Jan 10.

results_reference.citation: Zhang Z, Wei Y, Jiang X, Zhang S. PARS PLANA VITRECTOMY AND WIDE INTERNAL LIMITING MEMBRANE PEELING WITH PERFLUOROPROPANE TAMPONADE FOR HIGHLY MYOPIC FOVEOSCHISIS-ASSOCIATED MACULAR HOLE. Retina. 2017 Feb;37(2):274-282. doi: 10.1097/IAE.0000000000001146.

patient_data.ipd_description: all individual participant data (IPD) that underlie results
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: After this study is finished the data will become available for 1year.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: The analytical data will be accessed in published articles.
